issues.description: The reference implementation of addGuestStudents in Lecture.java defines only one int parameter, but the problem statement and UML specify two parameters (an int and a String reason). This mismatch will confuse students about the correct method signature and how to handle the reason argument.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the addGuestStudents method signature in the solution to accept both an int and a String (reason) parameter, and update its implementation to record or process the reason, matching the problem statement and UML.

issues.description: The method signature for addGuestStudents is inconsistent: the problem statement and UML specify addGuestStudents(int, String) (including a reason parameter), and the template stub refers to this signature, but the solution implements addGuestStudents(int) without the String parameter. This mismatch creates confusion when students try to reconcile the UML requirement with the provided solution.
issues.suggested_fix:
Modify the solution’s addGuestStudents method to match the UML and template by adding the reason parameter, e.g.:
public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, String reason) { /* ... */ }
